title: Welcome
content:
# Welcome
This workshop presents a pedagogical sequence rooted in **constructivism**.

## What to expect
- Part 1: concise theory and context
- Part 2: a guided, hands‑on To‑Do List in Next.js

title: Learning Theory: Constructivism
content:
> Constructivism: learners build knowledge by experimenting, reflecting, and iterating.

- Errors are signals for adjustment, not failure.
- Doing precedes complete understanding; models emerge from practice.

title: Session Goal
content: Develop a working understanding of **Next.js** by building a small application from scratch.

title: Objectives
content:
- Identify the role of Next.js within the React ecosystem.
- Create and structure a simple application.
- Understand routing, components, and dynamic rendering.
- Practice state and event management to deliver features.

title: Teaching Context
content: Audience: web development students (intermediate). Duration: 90 minutes. Method: learning by doing in pairs. Tools: code editor, browser, Next.js documentation.

title: Learning Situation
content: Challenge: build a small Next.js application that allows users to manage a list of items. The instructor facilitates discovery, asks guiding questions, and provides checkpoints for reflection.

title: Pedagogical Phases
content: Introduction → Guided practice → Experimentation → Restitution → Evaluation

title: Reflection
content: Errors and tests are not detours; they are the learning path. By iterating from hypothesis to result, learners form robust mental models and professional habits.
quiz: Which step of your usual workflow benefits most from reflection? Why?

title: Begin the Workshop
content: You have the theoretical overview. Select **Next** to start Activity 2 and build the To‑do List application.
